tit.cmt: タイトルなのでtheを取りました。

sen.j: 尾張徳川家は、徳川氏の支系徳川御三家の一つで、尾張藩主の家系。
sen.e: The Owari Tokugawa family was one of the Tokugawa gosanke (three privileged branches of the Tokugawa family) families, which was a subsidiary line of the Tokugawa clan; and the Owari Tokugawa family was the family lineage for the lord of the Owari Domain.

The Owari Tokugawa family was a subsidiary line of the Tokugawa family and one of Tokugawa Gosanke (three privileged branches of the Tokugawa family); and its successive family heads assumed the lord of Owari Domain.

The Owari Tokugawa family was a subsidiary line of the Tokugawa family and one of Tokugawa Gosanke (three privileged branches of the Tokugawa family); and its successive family heads assumed the lord of Owari Domain.

sen.j: 単に「尾張家」・「尾州家」とも言う。
sen.e: The Owari Tokugawa family was simply referred to as "the Owari family" and "the Bishu family."
It is simply referred to as "the Owari family" or "the Bishu family."
It is simply referred to as "the Owari family" or "the Bishu family."

sen.j: 徳川御三家中の筆頭格にして、諸大名の中でも最高の家格を有した。
sen.e: The Owari Tokugawa family held the position of head rank in the Tokugawa gosanke family; also, the Owari Tokugawa family held the highest family status among many daimyos (Japanese feudal lord).
It was ranked the highest among three families of Tokugawa Gosanke and held the highest family status among daimyos (Japanese feudal lords).
It was ranked the highest among three families of Tokugawa Gosanke and held the highest family status among daimyos (Japanese feudal lords).

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 徳川家康の九男徳川義直を家祖とし、江戸時代を通じて尾張藩を治めた。
sen.e: Yoshinao TOKUGAWA, the ninth son of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, founded the Owari Tokugawa family, and the Owari Tokugawa family governed the Owari Domain throughout the Edo period.
It was founded by Yoshinao TOKUGAWA, the ninth son of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, and governed Owari Domain throughout the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 言葉の重複を避けました。
sen.e: It was founded by Yoshinao TOKUGAWA, the ninth son of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, and governed Owari Domain throughout the Edo period.

sen.j: 徳川将軍家に後継ぎがないときは他の御三家とともに後嗣を出す資格を有した。
sen.e: When the Tokugawa Shogun family was without a successor, the Owari Tokugawa family held the right to nominate a successor from within their own family and with the other two Tokugawa gosanke families
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: When the Tokugawa Shogun family was not blessed with a son to become the next Shogun, the Owari Tokugawa family along with two other Tokugawa Gosanke families held a right to nominate the successor of the Shogun from their families.
sen.cmt: 文法の誤りを直し、分かりやすいように表現を改めました。
sen.e: When the Tokugawa Shogun family was not blessed with a son to become the next Shogun, the Owari Tokugawa family along with two other Tokugawa Gosanke families held a right to nominate the successor of the Shogun from their families.

sen.j: しかし、七代将軍の徳川家継没後、徳川継友と将軍後継を争った末に、紀州徳川家出身の徳川吉宗が八代将軍に就任。
sen.e: However, after Ietsugu TOKUGAWA, the seventh Shogun died, the Owari Tokugawa family competed with Tsugutomo TOKUGAWA for the successor of Shogun.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, the family, backing its family head Tsugutomo TOKUGAWA, lost in the competition for the Shogun's position which had occurred after the death of the seventh Shogun Ietsugu TOKUGAWA, and ultimately Yoshimune TOKUGAWA from the Kishu Tokugawa family assumed the eighth Shogun.
sen.cmt: 「徳川継友」は尾張徳川家の藩主なので、compete withとするのは誤りだと思います。文の流れを良くする為、本文と後列の文を一文にまとめました（原文では本文と前後あわせて３文が一文となっています）。
sen.e: However, the family, backing its family head Tsugutomo TOKUGAWA, lost in the competition for the Shogun's position which had occurred after the death of the seventh Shogun Ietsugu TOKUGAWA, and ultimately Yoshimune TOKUGAWA from the Kishu Tokugawa family assumed the eighth Shogun.

sen.j: その後には御三卿が創設されたため、結局、尾張家からは征夷大将軍を出せなかった。
sen.e: Afterwards, the gosankyo (three privileged branches of Tokugawa family) was established for choosing a successor to the Shogun; so, the Owari family never produced a successor to the Seitaishogun (commander-in-chief of the expeditionary force against the barbarians; a great, unifying leader).

Afterward, Gosankyo (Three Lord: three junior collateral houses of the Tokugawa family) was established, so the Owari Tokugawa family was not able to produce a Seitaishogun (the formal title name of the Shogun, which originally means the commander-in-chief of the expeditionary force against the barbarians) to the end.
sen.cmt: スペルミスを直し、御三卿、征夷大将軍の定義を直しました。
sen.e: Afterward, Gosankyo (Three Lord: three junior collateral houses of the Tokugawa family) was established, so the Owari Tokugawa family was not able to produce a Seitaishogun (the formal title name of the Shogun, which originally means the commander-in-chief of the expeditionary force against the barbarians) to the end.

sen.j: 尾張德川家の支系（御連枝）として、美濃国高須藩を治めた高須松平家がある。
sen.e: The Takasu Matsudaira Family who governed the Takasu Domain of Mino Province was a subsidiary line of the Owari Tokugawa family (Gorenshi [an honorific naming for a brother of a prestigious nobleman]).
The Takasu Matsudaira family, which governed Takasu Domain in Mino Province, was one of subsidiary line (called "Gorenshi") of the Owari Tokugawa family.
The Takasu Matsudaira family, which governed Takasu Domain in Mino Province, was one of subsidiary line (called "Gorenshi") of the Owari Tokugawa family.

sen.j: しかし、共に短命の藩主が多く、1799年に尾張德川家、その1801年には高須松平家で、義直の男系子孫は断絶してしまう。
sen.e: However, the head family of the Owari Tokugawa family and the Takasu Matsudaira Family, for both of family, many of their head family had a short life; so, Yoshinao's male descendant discontinued for the Owari Tokugawa family in 1799; and then, for the Takasu Matsudaira Family, Yoshinao's male descendant discontinued in 1801.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, many of the family heads of both the Owari Tokugawa and Takasu Matsudaira families were short-lived; therefore, Yoshinao's direct male descendants died out in the Owari Tokugawa family in 1799, and in the Takasu Matsudaira family in 1801.
sen.cmt: 表現を簡潔にし、語を変えました。
sen.e: However, many of the family heads of both the Owari Tokugawa and Takasu Matsudaira families were short-lived; therefore, Yoshinao's direct male descendants died out in the Owari Tokugawa family in 1799, and in the Takasu Matsudaira family in 1801.

sen.j: 19世紀以降の尾張徳川家は養子相続を繰り返して現在に至っている。
sen.e: After the 19th century, the Owari Tokugawa family continued the practice of succession by adoption up to present day Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In and after the nineteenth century, the Owari Tokugawa family managed successions by adoption to continue the family up to today.
sen.cmt: 表現を簡潔にし、訳抜け部を補足しました。
sen.e: In and after the nineteenth century, the Owari Tokugawa family managed successions by adoption to continue the family up to today.

sen.j: 明治維新後は華族に列し、侯爵を授けられた。
sen.e: After Meiji Restoration, the Owari Tokugawa family lined up with the kazoku (noble) family and received the title of marquis.
After the Meiji Restoration, the Owari Tokugawa family was ranked among kazoku (the nobility) and received the title of Marquis.
After the Meiji Restoration, the Owari Tokugawa family was ranked among kazoku (the nobility) and received the title of Marquis.

sen.j: 越前松平家から養子に入った十九代当主徳川義親は、財団法人尾張徳川黎明会（現（財）徳川黎明会）を設立した。
sen.e: Yoshichika TOKUGAWA was the nineteenth head in the family of the Owari Tokugawa family and an adopted child from the Echizen Matsudaira family; he founded The Owari Tokugawa Reimeikai foundation (this foundation is presently referred to as The Tokugawa Reimeikai foundation.).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Yoshichika TOKUGAWA, the 19th family head of the Owari Tokugawa family adopted from the Echizen Matsudaira family, founded the Owari Tokugawa Reimeikai Foundation (at present, the Tokugawa Reimeikai foundation).

Yoshichika TOKUGAWA, the 19th family head of the Owari Tokugawa family adopted from the Echizen Matsudaira family, founded the Owari Tokugawa Reimeikai Foundation (at present, the Tokugawa Reimeikai foundation).

sen.j: 1935年、愛知県名古屋市東区名古屋市)の尾張徳川家の別邸跡地に徳川美術館を開いた。
sen.e: In 1935, The Tokugawa Reimeikai foundation opened The Tokugawa Museum at the remaining second residence of the Owari Tokugawa family in Higashi Ward, Nagoya City, Aichi Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In 1935, this foundation opened the Tokugawa Museum at the site of the second residence of the Owari Tokugawa family in Higashi Ward, Nagoya City, Aichi Prefecture.
In 1935, this foundation opened the Tokugawa Museum at the site of the second residence of the Owari Tokugawa family in Higashi Ward, Nagoya City, Aichi Prefecture.

sen.j: 徳川美術館では、源氏物語絵巻をはじめとする尾張徳川家伝来の貴重な文化財を保存し公開している。
sen.e: In The Tokugawa Museum, The Tokugawa Reimeikai foundation preserved and displayed important traditional cultural properties which were handed down from their ancestors, the Owari Tokugawa family; the collection of these items began with Genji Monogatari Emaki (Illustrated hand scrolls of the Tale of Genji).

There, valuable cultural properties that had been handed down in the Owari Tokugawa family, including Genji Monogatari Emaki (illustrated hand scrolls of the Tale of Genji), are preserved and exhibited.
sen.cmt: 表現を簡潔にし、語を変えました。
sen.e: There, valuable cultural properties that had been handed down in the Owari Tokugawa family, including Genji Monogatari Emaki (illustrated hand scrolls of the Tale of Genji), are preserved and exhibited.

sen.j: 歴代当主と後嗣たち
sen.e: The successive family heads and the successors
Successive family heads and their offspring
sen.cmt: タイトルなのでtheを取り、若干語を変えました。
sen.e: Successive family heads and their offspring

sen.e: Tomoatsu (later, he became the third lord of the Takasu Domain, Yoshiatsu; further more, he became successor to the head of the Owari Tokugawa family; then he became the eighth lord of the Owari Domain, Munekatsu TOKUGAWA.)

sen.j: 十二代（藩主） 徳川斉荘 （なりたか／田安徳川家から養子、十一代将軍徳川家斉の実子）
